rmk: Same individual as the other recording by me from the same site, one minute apart. Recordings spliced as people were talking. First "pip" call when the bird was perched on a tree beside me, "tsk" calls when it flew, second "pip" call as it hovered infront of another tree for a split second, and following "tsk" as it continued flying off.

file-name: XC340753-scarlet-backed flowerpecker singing in the rain.mp3
rmk: Watch a video of this bird singing this song at:  <https://youtu.be/XxdGvUS0ZtE>. This male scarlet-backed flowerpecker was singing during a moderate rain, at the top of a 10 metre Vitex pinnata tree.  While it was mainly singing a repetitive single note, it would occasionally add "trills and runs" to it's song. This can be heard at  the **0:11** and **0:54** second mark of the recording.
